data: A lexical resource based on WordNet that assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains about 5000 text snippets collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for sentiment analysis in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies for more effective recognition, interpretation, and processing of opinions in this context.

Includes entity-level sentiment annotation to address the problem of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiment. This manually annotated dataset contains over 10,700 news headlines and provides information on sentiment variations depending on specific entities in financial news.

A set of tokenized and annotated data, including speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). The resource is designed to analyze the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by studying the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relations in financial documents, containing about 29,000 examples and 22 relation types, covering eight entity pairs (e.g., person-position, organization-amount), extracted from SEC 10-X reports. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by experts (manually), allowing researchers to study how news headlines affect price movements, asset comparison, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial companies in text data.

A multilingual financial NLP dataset featuring real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high- and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class classification and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with in-depth analysis of financial reports. Created by financial experts and focused on deep logical inference based on financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial queries.
